p: The detection of volatile organic compounds using an [Au(PPh 2C(CSSAuC 6F 5)PPh 2Me) 2][ClO 4] vapochromic material incorporated into a sol-gel matrix deposited onto a tapered optical fibre with a waist diameter of 19 Î¼m and of length 1 mm was reported [ 124]. Changes of up to 13.5 dB in the transmitted optical power were detected on exposure to different concentrations of acetone and dichloromethane vapours. The sensing mechanism relied on the measurement of the decrease of the transmitted power through the tapered fibre caused by a vapour-induced RI change of the coating.
